meanings.definition: A person who compiles or arranges texts.
meanings.sent1: The textuaries at the library organized all the books on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The textuaries in the publishing house worked diligently to compile the manuscripts.
meanings.sent3: The textuaries had a competition to see who could arrange the most books in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a textuaries' paradise with books neatly stacked everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The textuaries' passion for organizing texts was evident in their meticulous work.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of texts.
meanings.sent1: The textuaries analysis of the ancient scrolls revealed fascinating details.
meanings.sent2: The textuaries approach to literature was analytical and thorough.
meanings.sent3: The textuaries' party theme was all about books and reading.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so neat, it looked almost textuaries in style.
meanings.sent5: The textuaries nature of the document made it easy to understand and interpret.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study or analysis of texts.
meanings.sent1: The textuaries research on the manuscript shed light on its origins.
meanings.sent2: Her textuaries examination of the poem revealed hidden meanings.
meanings.sent3: The textuaries' detective work on the ancient text was both exciting and informative.
meanings.sent4: The textuaries approach to the novel uncovered layers of symbolism.
meanings.sent5: His textuaries analysis of the document impressed his colleagues with its depth.
